page.title: 17Hall and Church, Great Alne
page.content: The Great Alne Village Hall was built in the early 1920's as a memorial for the Great War. It has been used for a variety of activities such as rifle practice for the Home Guard, dances, drama group, a library and auctions. Every year a Christmas party and a big summer event are held. Regular activities include a dog club, W.I., Senior Citizens, Brownies, Cubs and Scouts. The flag pole commemorates the coronation of Queen Elizabeth II. Great Alne church is linked with Kinwarton and Haselor churches and shares the Rector. Attached to the church is a club for teenagers, a Mother's Union and a Discussion Group. There is a rota arranged for Church cleaning, putting flowers in the church and tidying the church yard. Few children under 11 live in the village, so there is no Sunday School.
